today i was in the subway and i was lookin for the price of RER tickets on a machine that delivers these tickets and a beggar comes up to me. so he asks me for money and as im lookin thru my purse (yea i was in a generous mood) he sees that i was lookin for somethin on the machine. so for some reason he decides to help me out, and we started talkin about why i wanted to buy these tickets and blabla. he was really kind and helpful and he gave me all the info i needed, which saved me the time i wouldve spent in the queue at the information office.. anyways i finally found my wallet and i gave him money and that was a terribly awkward moment. the fact that we'd been talkin and socializin and exchangin something apparently made it really weird for him to receive money from me. we didnt say that but there was a blank in the convo as i handed him the money and we both looked embarrassed. does this mean that beggars only want money from strangers with no name? or does this mean i subconsciously would have preferred to consider him as a stranger with no name? human relationships are so encoded with rituals, pre set situations that u cant free yourself from that it makes me wanna scream. was i goin astray by exchangin a few words with someone who begs in the streets? the man was too thin to look healthy but he was pretty anyway. and he had a cool piercing

so i left on friday, and arrived late for the eurostar, cuz there was a (tiny) bomb in a station of the suburban train i took, and we got stuck two stations away from where i was goin, pffft. sometimes its annoyin to be in paris, theres always somethin, meh. anyways, i did catch the train at the last minute. we were all excited and we annoyed everybody cuz we kept talkin in the train. we took the tube in london, thank god we kno how that works, cuz its so complicated, its like, u gotta have a degree in geography to find your way in there! anyways we got to the b&b we had booked, which was in Notting Hill (yea, thats the way u gotta treat a girl), and... WOW. that was the best place i ever stayed in. the lady let us enter a first room, with twin beds, lovely and all, and she said there had been a misunderstanding, and that someone would have to sleep in another room upstairs. so i volunteered to be the one left out, and we went upstairs, and it was like the loveliest room ever, with a HUGE bed (which i took a pic of, lol, i mean the place was like twice the size of my place here !). i had a tv and a couch and a mini fridge and everything u need to make tea, woohoo. So we got ready and went out to the pub at the corner, and started drinkin. then we went to Tiger lil's, which is an asian restaurant at Islington. u pile up veggies and meat in a plate and then they cook it in a wok in front of u with noodles and sauce and all, so u can choose what u're eatin and yea, it was great. australian wine. then it was like 12 so we went out in the street and pple gave us fliers for clubs (random guys callin u "baby", wth). we went to this club where they played music from the 80s, haha that was fun. guys started talkin to us and i found myself explainin to that dude what the lyrics of madonna's "like a virgin" really mean, accordin to Tarantino (thats in Reservoir dogs). so yea, that was kinda weird and i reckon pple are not used to hearin strangers tellin them that kinda thing, but i was drunk, heh. he got all excited cuz i was french, and i had to listen to the eternal "french pple are arrogant" speech, pffft, can u tell he wasnt bein original.. i told him to calm down and when we left he said itd been nice to meet me and he had respect for me cuz i didnt let him touch me or w/e when a lot of girls would have wilfully cheated on their bf.. wth is with cheaters these days, geez, is it like a new trend? i dont find it really hard to not cheat on someone if u really care for them and dont wanna hurt them (yea, im talkin about u lovah, lol). anyways its the same as in france, and everywhere in the world i guess, guys in clubs are part of the 'desperate for sex' species. moderately sex-cravin guys dont go to clubs. (yea, not sex-cravin guys dont exist). so yea, we went back to the hotel. i couldnt sleep, of course. blah. so a couple of non-sleep hours later we went to the market on Portobello Rd, where i bought : union jack thongs, haha, (no comment please, that was a joke, lol), hilarious postcards for pple =), (i only found those after i sent Val hers, so yea, sorry hun, u didnt get a funny card), i bought funky colored rollin paper, and junk food. then we went to Harrods, where we spent like an hour in the toy department playin with kids toys cuz we're still 8 =). we also went to Oxford Street and all, spent some time in Mango (yea thats where i got u your top Roxy), Topshop etc. *sigh* i love London. ok, then in the evening we went to GalliPolli at Islington again. thats a turkish restaurant (turkish? not sure in fact.. man i dont even kno what i ate) but it has the most delicious.. stuff. lol the food was awesome =). then we went to Cargo, a club somewhere (i dont remember cuz i was pretty wasted after the wine at GalliPolli -- Chilien wine that was in fact imported from France, we discovered that later lol). the club was awesome in terms of pple, but the dj only played techno music, so yea, we didnt really enjoy that. so instead of dancing we drank more, Bacardi Breezer (woohoo, cranberry bacardi IS tasty). i went up to a girl and i randomly told her she was really hot, and she looked at me weird, haha. i was only sayin, i mean i added that i was just tellin her that cuz it was a shame that no one had told her that in the past hour. yea ok im probably weird, but wouldnt u like it if someone randomly told u u were beautiful? she looked really british, only without the sl*tty clothes, heh. british girls dress like wh*res, excuse my french. i mean i had never seen shorter skirts, i wonder how they dont get raped -- maybe they do =(. anyways, we left the club and went to a different one where we got in for free cuz it was gonna close in an hour. the music was better but yea, we were tired. we took the bus home and in the bus a guy asked me if pple did weed in France. duu-uh. we also have better weed, idiot. (lol) i didnt say that tho. i almost fell asleep in the bus too, so i was hopin he'd stop talkin to me. 5 hours of sleep at the hotel. next day was Camden Town day =). It was great as well. I bouuuught : a 'Nightmare before Xmas' handbag, it looks SO cool, a shroom patch to sew on my jeans, a new barbell, weeee, and i refrained from buyin shoes... then we went to Sainsbury to spend the last pounds we had and i bought more junk food to bring back home. we ran back to the b&b to get our luggage, and we had to take a taxi to Victoria cuz we were late for the eurostar. that cost us 15 FRIGGIN QUIDS. ugh. Madrid's taxis are so cheap, i cant believe how expensive english taxis are. anyways, we took the eurostar altho none of us wanted to go back to Paris. in the train we phoned Azad cuz Caroline wanted to kno how the football game was goin, so yea, that was 1-0 for England at the time. then we arrived in Paris, Noëlle and I took the suburban train and Caroline was home before we arrived so she called me on my cell to yell in my ear that we had won the game. good good. i went home and i put on my eyebrow barbell and i hurt myself in the process ='(. then i went online to read my emails. nice quizzes u sent me mates, i didnt kno Cendre thought Gabe and I were her thexiest friends, how weird is that, lol. then i got struck by a terrible feeling of loneliness, as i had spent the weekend with pple and was findin myself alone again ='(. so i was a lil sad to be home, altho val, natie and matt talked to me a bit, but yea, i missed my lovah i went to bed and i skipped the first class today cuz i couldnt wake up (yea i had missed my bed as well, lol). all day long i had my kids watch movies cuz i hadnt prepared any lesson for them, lol. so i watched the first 50 minutes of Sleepy Hollow 3 times and the first 50 minutes of Back to the Future twice. it can get boring, for me, but they enjoyed it a lot. i think we're watching movies til the end of the schoolyear =) (well the end of both movies first and then i dunno). i drove another teacher back home cuz im nice like that (and i do that every monday too, lol) went to the store and bought drinks and food, and here i am. phew, that was long and probably boring for whoevers readin, but it was nice for me to write all that. great memories from my london trip =)... i cant believe i was there just yesterday, i think im gonna do that more often =) im gonna shut up now and hurry Gabe cuz i wanna kno about your weekend

I noticed they were all wearing pink clothes, and one day I was sittin at a café and I started observing all the girls passin by in Grafton St and I swear I haven’t found one who wasn’t wearin at least one pink item (the total pink look is really scary too). (The only girls I saw who werent wearing pink were Spanish so I don’t count them.) The irish teacher I worked with wore a different pink tee every single day. guys : they watch/play/talk about soccer/gaelic football a lot. boring. they’re also scary. they look big and like they’re gonna hit u if u say something they don’t like. and Irish bus drivers are really really rude. generally : irish pple don’t smile. maybe they dunno how to, GO FIGURE Dublin, a one-horse-place Dublin’s fair city is SO small. (that’s compared to other european capitals). Don’t get me wrong, i like the city but geez, just 2 weekends there and u’ve seen everything there is to see (shops and pubs included). They make it look big by havin a hundred McD and Burger Kings everywhere. u tend to see the trick when u’ve passed 5 of those in the same street. The national sport, aka drinkin Any kind of alcoholic drink (say, a lager) is like 5 freakin euros there. I’d have to get a second job if i wanted to get drunk. The easy trick would have been be to have guys buy me drinks, which they seemed eager to do, but that would have been mean considering I didn’t intend to sleep with them plus i was dead scared of them (see § about guys above). After wasting €25 one night just to feel only slightly dizzy, I decided to stay sober (how ironic, I mean, hello, I was in Ireland). Best memory Noémie (cool gal) and i laughed a lot at the idea that since Ireland is a tiny island, intermarrying must be a rule, and that explains the lookin-alike thing. i also laughed when Kathleen (our host mom) said something about Coronation Street and Noémie understood “Cornichon Street” (Gherkin Street). Kathleen was really the sweetest person. Funny accent too, she is Scottish. In conclusion, after much thinking, i prefer England.
